intro: Ania hookeriana, commonly known as the Hooker's ania, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hair. Ania hookeriana is often found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes.
